page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY/LAW (STURTON)
page.content: { LOCAL HISTORY STURTON HAS AN OLD{QUAKER BURIAL {GROUND}WITH SOME VACANT PLOTS. THE { {QUAKER MEETING HOUSE}IS NOW CONVERTED INTO A PRIVATE DWELLING. THE{PRIMITIVE METHODIST & WESLEYAN {CHAPELS}ARE NOW PRIVATE GARAGES. THE{OLD SCHOOLROOM,}OWNED BY THE PARISH,IS REGULARLY USED FOR PARISH MEETINGS AND DOCTORS' SURGERIES. THERE IS CONCERN THAT THESE SURGERIES COULD CEASE. { LAW & ORDER THERE ARE NO RESIDENT POLICEMEN IN THE AREA,BUT REGULAR PATROLS ARE MADE BY{ {SAXILBY COMMUNITY POLICEMEN & {GAINSBOROUGH H.Q.}BEING A RURAL AREA, STURTON HAS COMPARATIVELY LITTLE CRIME OR VANDALISM. HAVING A HIGH COURT JUDGE RESIDING IN THE AREA SOMETIMES NECESSITATES EXTRA POLICING FOR HIS PERSONAL PROTECTION.
